results.title: Organics: food for thought
results.creator_credit: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Organic farmers work with nature rather than against it, a process of positive cooperation with the soil, without the intervention of chemicals, in order to produce a quality product. Filmed on location in Victoria, this video covers the production, marketing, export potential and labelling of organic produce in Australia. It features citrus grower, Robert Ridgewell; bio-dynamic wheat/sheep farmer, John Greenwood; vegetable grower, Neville Cann and Ian Diamond, organic wholesaler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs

results.title: Hard work and hope: Australia's Italians
results.creator_credit: Equality Press and Italian Historical Society
results.brief_description: Designed to enable Australian Studies students appreciate the role of migrant labour in Australia. Focuses on the theme of work as experienced by Italian immigrants both before and after World War II. Photographs, newsreel footage and moving footage from the Italian Historical Society documents the contribution of Australia’s Italians to the community through their work. Accompanied by a 19p. Teacher’s Guide.

results.title: A Real man's job: Images of Australian women in wartime [kit]
results.creator_credit: Felicity Cockram, Australian War Memorial, History Teacher's Association of Victoria and ImMEDIAte Action
results.brief_description: Subtitled Images of Australian women in wartime this kit aims to identify the real contribution that women made during both world wars and also at the images of women in wartime that were projected. Authored by Tim Gurry, Robert Lewis and Richard Reid, the kit draws together a wide variety of material with suggestions for its use, into nine Evidence Files, a videocassette and Teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Future of Our Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times discuss the current decline of the newspaper industry. They give their opinions and make their predictions as to the future of journalism and the newspaper houses.

results.title: Reading Australian Film
results.brief_description: This is a film about how to watch films. The reason for making a film is to tell a story by using vision and sound. The finished version often taps into experiences we ourselves have had in real life. But film is not reality… it is a constructed medium which conveys messages of fact, fiction and emotion.

results.title: Double concerto: a film about the pianist Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Hugh Piper, Angela Catterns, Abstract Productions and Endeavour Film Productions
results.brief_description: The star of “Double Concerto” is the brilliant Australian pianist Roger Woodward. His inspiration and fellow musician is the equally brilliant Polish violinist, Wanda Wilkomirska. Together they play the double concerto “Southern Cross”, a concerto written especially for them by Australia’s most internationally acclaimed composer, Barry Conyingham. The film follows Roger and Wanda in rehearsal, in concert and in rambling walks along the sea shores. They discuss their music, their politics and their personal lives.

results.title: Heads 'n' Tails (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Kay Francis and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A program that depicts the inter action between a group of teenagers coping with the pressures of growing up in an urban environment. An educational and entertaining video with a sequel called “On The Loose”.

results.title: Women in the workforce
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth De Rome and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: The claim that sex is destiny is thought by many to be ludicrous, yet in practice, is this actually the case? The express purpose of this film is to promote discussion of and around the conscious and unconscious barriers women have to face daily in the workforce.

results.title: No more secrets
results.brief_description: Explores the issues of Child Abuse and provides strategies for both children and adults to enable them to deal with “secrets” which children often feel obliged to keep to themselves.

results.title: An Australian Summer
results.brief_description: A gentle comedy exploring, on a humorous and compassionate level, the shifting relationships within an Australian family over two decades, 1960-1980. The complexities of a family relationship where love as a binding force is tested by disappointment, are evocatively portrayed with a deft mixture of humour and poignancy.
